title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 197.9 - Contingent license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 197.9 - Contingent license

State Regulations
(a) Any
contingent license issued pursuant to prior provisions of this Part will remain
in effect until: (1)
superseded by the
issuance of a license to guide pursuant to the terms of this Part; (2)
revoked pursuant to the terms of this

Part; (3)
revoked for failure to
pass the written examination required by this Part; or
(4)
revoked for failure to provide any of the
required proofs, certifications or statements enumerated in section
197.3
of this Part within 90 days
of issuance of any contingent license. (b) All guides holding contingent licenses
issued pursuant to the prior provisions of this Part must successfully pass the
written examination required by section
197.6
of this Part within six
months of the effective date of this Part, or such additional time thereafter
as is necessary to permit two administrations of such examination. Failure to
successfully complete such examination within the time specified will result in
automatic revocation of the contingent license. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
197.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
